reviewText: Great old school classic scary movies! Have to have them all, buy new or used...this item shipped as new! Worth it to have as a 3 pack

reviewText: This is a great gift pack for someone who likes this series.  I highly recommend this set to any one.
summary: I know what you did last summer trilogy
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had seen the first and second movie a long time ago and knew that they were okay, not the best but far from the worst. However I hadn't seen the second movie and it was alot cheaper to buy them in a bundle. The third movie was one of the worst things I have ever seen! I don't understand how this storyline got twisted so far! It is worth buying the collection for the first two and watching the third for a good laugh!
summary: First ad Second movie are ok
Title: N/A

reviewText: This,I Know what you did last Summer collection,features I Know What You Did Last Summer(released Oct/97),I Still Know What You Did Last Summer(released Nov/98)and finally I'll Always Know What You Did Last Summer(released Aug/06).I personally found them all to be pretty scary films,with a good ominous vibe created throughout.All the films hinge on one important aspect:whether or not you can believe their initial excuses for not reporting things to the cops.If you can buy that then you just have to sit back and let things unfold.All three are directed by different directors but all three did a good job putting their personal stamps on each film."I Know What You Did.." is the first and the best of the bunch.This has Jennifer Love Hewitt as Julie Nicole James,Sarah Michelle Gellar as Helen Shivers,Ryan Phillippe as Barry William Cox andFreddie Prinze Jr.as Ray Bronson.The film opens with a drunk young man perched at the edge of a cliff.This is July 4th and when the young man looks up at fireworks the scene switches to the festivities in town and our four protagonists.They decide to go out of town to a remote beach.On the way back they run over someone.They all panic,assume the worst,and decide to ditch the body in the water and promise never to discuss it with anyone.Almost a year passes and virtually all of their lives have been changed by what happened.However notes start to appear telling them that someone is on to them.They think the person they hit was the son of a local fisherman and they visit the sister of the boy(Anne Heche)to verify things.However it turns out that they didn't hit the son,but rather the father,Ben Willis;and they didn't kill him and he is out for revenge.The film's survivors are Prinze and Hewitt.The film ends as Hewitt is taking a shower at school when Willis comes crashing through a shower door at her.4 -4 1/2 stars.The ending is what it is,as the next movie doesn't explain what happened(maybe a dream?).The film's stars all do a good job and the editing and plot move along very well.4 4 1/2 stars."I Still know what you Did..."has Prinze and Hewitt back.They are joined this time by Brandy as Karla Wilson and her boyfriend played by Mekhi Phifer as Tyrell Martin.Hewitt and Prinze have been apart from the last film,and she is at University now with roommate Brandy.Brandy wins a trip to the Bahamas which Prinze fails to catch.Along comes (Matthew Settle as) Will Benson,who likes Hewitt,but feelings aren't really reciprocated.Things initially go fairly well except most of the staff,especially the desk clerk played wonderfully by Jeffrey Coombs(Wayoun,DS9),are really creepy and belligerent.Storm season has just started,and them being on a remote island of course makes the mood even more foreboding.Slowly but surely things start to happen and before you know it they are being stalked,and killed.It's finally revealed not only is Willis after them again,but good old Will Benson is none other than Willi's son,who has been helping Dad stack the bodies up.The film ends as Hewitt and Prinze are back home,living together.While Prinze is in the bathroom Hewitt hears strange noises which culminates in her being pulled underneath the bed.Again the film features another ending that is unresolved.Look for Jack Black(wearing dreadlocks of all things!)as Titus,a resort maintenance man who loves to smoke up.4 stars."I Will always Know What you did..." features Brooke Nevin as Amber Williams,David Paetkau as Colby Patterson,Torrey DeVitto as Zoe Warner and Seth Packard as Roger Pack as this films four protagonists.The last two films were situated in SouthPort,North Carolina,here we are in a small town in Colorado.The four decide to stage an elaborate prank on the citizenry at the 4th of July festivities.They dredge up the Ben Willis character from North Carolina as Roger dresses up as him.He appears,and pretends to go after his friends,as they run through a carnival in mock terror.The prank ends atop and at the edge of some stadium steps.The towns sheriff's son is on a skateboard and while trying to jump off the end to safety ,accidentally lands and impales himself on the exhaust of a tractor.The four vow never to tell anyone of their secret.However,like the other films,it is apparent someone knows what really happened and is seriously bent on their demise.As they probe into who it may be,they find out that their suspicions were wrong.As the film progresses deaths become more frequent until it culminates at a concert where one of the group has a concert.After her gig they intend to leave but they get hunted down in the building behind.Some escape and finally confront their stalker who it turns out is not Ben Willis himself,but an evil entity dressed like him.They finally get him into a wood chipper and he goes to pieces.The film ends with the requisite screaming ending.This time it is Amber alone driving through a remote Southwest U.S.area when she gets a flat.She gets out and hears a sound and the film fades to black as she turns,sees the fisherman and the slashing hook silences herscreams.This film is not up to par with the rest,but is not too bad.It has some very interesting scenarios throughout,like the business with the gondolas.You don't see too many tense moments in films involving gondolas.Like the previous two,this film doesn't deal with the ending from the previous one,and leaves the viewer wondering about its own ending.It's initial catalyst(the prank gone wrong)was played out well and believable and the change in scenery and the ideas springing from that seemed to generate some good business throughout.3-3 1/2 stars.Technically speaking the films are all in their w/s a/r's of 2:35:1 for the first two and 1:85:1 for the last.Each disc,single sided is in a slim pack has various extras on them,too many to mention here;usually commentary,trailers and featurettes.Generally the films look very good.All in all,a good threesome of some pretty delightfully scary teen slasher flicks.The first two outshine the last,but the last one isn't that bad either.Recommended.
summary: A quite enjoyable trio of films!
